Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to prove that the Texas Capitol faces south toward Goliad in memory of the battle of the Texas Revolution.
Problematic assumption: The assumption that the Texas Capitol faces south toward Goliad solely in memory of the battle of the Texas Revolution is not adequately supported or proven.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why the Texas Capitol faces south, which are not explored or mentioned in the provided information.
Falters at times: The claim is not consistently supported or substantiated throughout the provided information, leading to inconsistencies and uncertainties.
Understate: The claim may understate the significance or complexity of the reasons behind the orientation of the Texas Capitol.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the previous Capitol, built in 1853, also faced south, suggesting that the orientation may not be solely related to the battle of the Texas Revolution.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the importance or direct connection between the orientation of the Texas Capitol and the battle of the Texas Revolution.
